data.title: Class Notes Bellarmine Preparatory School
data.text:
Bill Schwarz B’70 is retired and now resides in Las Vegas, NV.

Thomas Harper B'71 has been happily married for 43 years with two children and three grandchildren. He attended Central Washington University and graduated with a degree in education. Thomas and his wife are enjoying the retired life in a beautiful community called Verrado.

Joseph Hobson B’71 and his wife Menchilita have four grandchildren Maddox (9), Oliver (7), Jovi (3), and Theo (20 months).

Ann Bowling A’72 and her husband Danny welcomed their 3rd grandchild on October 5th, 2021 a healthy baby boy.

Mark Cavanagh B'72 - A.B., Columbia University 1976, J.D. cum laude, Order of the Coif, Omicron Delta Kappa, Burks Scholar, Washington and Lee University, 1982. He was employed at law firms, including Culp, Dwyer, Guterson, and Grader; Carney, Badley, Smith, and Spellman. And was also employed on construction projects for Brown and Root, Inc., now KBR, Inc., in Arkansas, Alabama, Oklahoma, Mississippi, and Texas as a journeyman pipefitter for ten projects over seven years. Mark is now retired.

George Graham Jr. B’72 just celebrated his 47th wedding anniversary. He has two daughters and he has been retired from the Department of Defense since 2009.

Ray Ybarra B'73 lives in Portland, OR.

Janis Shoup Arruda A’74 resides in Tucson, AZ with her husband Patrick.

Ruthanne Cortez SL’74 is an Army veteran, a San Diego State University alumni, Mom of four children and Nana of seven grandchildren. She is married to Scott Weiss.

Margaret ‘Peg’ Staeheli A’74 recently completed a two-month, 3,000-mile coast to coast bicycle trip from San Diego, CA to St. Augustine, FL.

Michael (Mick) Alsos B’76 retired in April 2022, after 35 years with The Boeing Company.

Greg Gardner B’76 retired in 2021 and is moving to Tennessee in 2023.

Dennis Nelson B’78 moved back to WA in 2021 after 42 years of combined time in the Navy and at the labs in Albuquerque.

Pete Warren B'78 retired from 40 years of service with Caterpillar Marine.

Ann McIntyre Webster B’78 is married with five children.

Peter Verbica B'78 has become a co-owner of Silicon Private Wealth as of January 1, 2024. In addition to his role as a principal, he continues to serve as a managing director. He hosts the popular Verb Presents Speaker Series, which has featured the former deputy director of the NSA (on cybersecurity), the former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine (on geopolitical tensions), and many other CEOs, authors, and experts. Verbica currently serves as the finance chair of the San Jose Symphony Foundation, a party county chair, and a state delegate.

Joseph Jagod B'79 joined the Coldwell Banker Bain real estate team with offices in University Place, Tacoma and Capitol Hill, Seattle.

John Keeley B’79 is a primary care Pediatrician in East Longmeadow, MA. His youngest of four children, Katherine, is graduating with a Nursing Degree from Fairfield University in Fairfield, CT. John has been married to his wife Denise for 36 years, the couple met as undergraduates at Georgetown University.

Peter Raquer B’79 has been married to his wife, Ann, for 36 years. They have two children, Hayley and Chase who also graduated from Bellarmine. Peter retired from The Boeing Company and currently works with the State of Arizona as a contract employee. He and Ann enjoy hiking, exploring Arizona, and fine dining.

Bob B'79 and Andrew B'15 Turner, made local history as the first father-son duo to officiate the 2022 WIAA Mat Classic. Read the full article here.

Bette Anne Spaulding Curry B’91 is celebrating 22 years in business as a chef.

Laura Luce Kelley B’91 serves on the Endowment Board for St. Joseph School Seattle and the Board of Directors for Bishop Blanchet High School. She lives in Seattle's Capitol Hill neighborhood with her husband and two teenage children.

Melissa “Missy” Hayward Goode B'92 works at The Learning Lab and lives in Boise, ID.

Brienne Quilici Iverson B'92 got married a few years ago and began working with Kiewit Building Group (Peter Kiewit and Sons) in the Western Operations Department of Building Group and Bridge and Marine. In July, she and her brother, Chad Quilici B'91, took their parents on a trip to Italy to visit family after they all received dual citizenship.

Patrick McNerthney B'92 wrote and published the book, "The Future Will Not Involve Underwear: Humor, Satire, and Outright Lies". His book can be found on Amazon or Bookshop.org, for print copies.

Heidi Pilarski Pecoraro B'92 completed residency at Cornell and fellowship at OHSU, and became a staff veterinary pathologist at the NDSU Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory. Since January 2022, she has taken on the role of Lab Director as well. She lives in Fargo, ND, just blocks from the Red River and Minnesota state line.

Ben Brooks B’93 became a Lead Digital Analytics Consultant at Infotrust in September, 2021.

Damani Leech B’94 was named President of the Denver Broncos. Read more.

John Fitzpatrick B’95 is an editor on the "Resident Evil" TV series for Netflix after previously working on the TV show "Supernatural" for the CW as an editor and a director. John has been married to Sarah Simek Fitzpatrick B’96 since June of 2008.

Clifton Funkhouser B’96 received the 2020 National Award for Investigative Excellence from The Federal Law Enforcement Officers Association. This award recognizes his work from 2016 to 2018, when he served as an assistant regional security officer-investigator at the U.S. Consulate in Nogales, Mexico near the southern border of Arizona. He now works as the Assistant Regional Security Officer at the U.S. Embassy in Riga, Latvia. To learn more about Cliff, read the Tacoma News Tribune article here.

Angela Rasmussen B’96 moved to Canada where she is a scientist and professor at the Vaccine and Infectious Disease Organization at the University of Saskatchewan.

Ezell Willis Jr. B’96 is married and received his MBA from Saint Martin’s University in 2010.

Katie Kloida Wilson B’96 has been hired as the next head coach of the Gonzaga University volleyball program. Katie was formerly the assistant coach at Notre Dame University.

Matthew J. Fish B'97 has been assigned as Pastor of St. Mary's Church in Newport, Maryland. Established in 1674, St. Mary's is the third oldest active parish in the United States. He is also teaching Religion at St. Mary's Ryken High School in Leonardtown, Maryland.

Erik Augustin B’99 is married.

Patrick Burke B'00 is a Principle Private Banker at BNY Mellon in Seattle.

Julianna Olson Haven B’02 has two kids, 16-year-old, Abigail, and 15-month-old, Khloe.

Jeffrey Stivers B’00 co-founded a new company - Outlier Journeys, which offers custom worldwide adventure travel trips.

Brittany Anderson B’03 and her husband Patrick, welcomed a little girl, Teagan Fletcher, in September.

Jessica Schreiner Goldberg B’03 has a Master’s Degree in Clinical Psychology. She is married and had a baby during the pandemic.

Stephanie Powell B’03 is the Blue Origin Program Manager for New Glenn's first stage.

Sarah Abouhamad Funk B’04 has been married to her husband, Joel, for 10 years. They have 5 children including a set of twins! Sarah double majored in Biochemistry from CWU. She opened a coffee shop called Mud & Char in the suburbs of Chicago where she currently resides with her blessed family. She works from home as a health & wellness blogger, aids her husband at his law firm and takes care of her children.

Stephen Pearson B’04 and his wife Erin welcomed a baby boy, Crew, in March 2023.

In June of 2023, Julia Montgomery Fretias B'04 and her husband welcomed twins David and James into their family. They are happy and healthy and everyone is adjusting perfectly to life as a family of six.

Brittney 'Britt' Harris B'05 released her debut single, "All of Me", on August 19, 2022.The track is produced by her brother, Nathan 'Nate' Harris B'10. You can stream/download “All of Me” on SoundCloud.

Caitlin Chaffee Keely B’05 and her husband, Sean, welcomed their second child, Iann Samuel Keely, who is loved by his big sister Ashley Irene Keely.

William Weisdepp B'05 was married June 3, 2023 at Bellarmine in the St. Aloysius Chapel to wife Mia Wrighti. William is a Sourcing Manager at Meta and lives in Seattle, WA.

Dr. John Gaines B'06 founder of PUSH for Dreams, was honored by Tacoma Mayor, Victoria Woodards when she proclaimed April 19, 2022, as PUSH for Dreams Day in the City of Tacoma.

Shey Marana Yip B’06 got married in 2020.

Jessica Jenkins Burkholder B'07 got married on February 9, 2018 to Ryan Burkholder. The two welcomed their first son, Ethan Burkholder on June 21,2019 and second son Aiden Burkholder June 9, 2021. Currently Jessica works as a Social Worker and dance teacher.

Ilaria Ghattas B’07 married Trenton Erker B’07 on February 12, 2023! They met on Bellarmine orientation day in 2003, and happened to be in the same homeroom too, and now are married 20 years later.

Austin Hoberg B'07 is a realtor with John L Scott in Tacoma.

Marisha Kasjan McDowell B'07 wrote and published her memoir, "Learning to Fly" in March 2021. Prospective readers can find it on Amazon.

Lauren Myers Troxell B'08 is expecting a baby due October 30, 2022.

Midori Starks White B'09 got married in 2019, graduated from medical school in 2021 and started a general surgery residency at Johns Hopkins 2021.
